image.altText: Attractive display of fresh vegetables and fruit in grocery store

props.synopsis: Mountains of food is wasted every year in Australia, while at the same time there's been a doubling in the need for food relief. Now, there is a push on to incentivise companies to donate more.Â

image.altText: A large amount of rubble, with smoke also visible rising from it

title.children: Israel 'determined to keep fighting' in Lebanon despite assassinating Hezbollah chief

image.altText: a Georgian House built in 1818 with a grand garden in front of it

props.synopsis: Since 2016, Liz and Rob Virtue have operated the colonial-era Glen Derwent as a tourism and hospitality business, but say Tasmanian government fees and charges along with mounting insurance premiums have forced them to close â€” with the state's tourism peak body saying stories of local enterprises struggling are commonplace.

title.children: Fees, charges and insurance costs, along with tourism downturn, the 'straw that breaks camel's back' for business owners

image.altText: A rocket ship taking off.

props.synopsis: NASA astronauts Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams won't be returning home until February 2025.

image.altText: A man speaks into a microphone with his hand in the air

title.children: Nasrallah turned an Islamist militia into a political force that will outlive him

image.altText: A man wearing a tie stands indoors, looking ahead. A neutral expression on his face.

image.altText: Kristen and Warren look down at their son Patrick, both smiling, as he pats a cat on the head.

props.synopsis: When Andrew Leech trained as a GP 11 years ago, he thought the main issues he'd be seeing in children would be coughs and colds. He wasn't anticipating the wave of children and teens battling mental health problems.Â

title.children: 'It's cruel' and 'He'll grow out of it': Parents' decision to medicate their children is met with judgement

image.altText: Six puppy labradoodles in a cage

image.altText: Women in blue suits holding red folders throw white documents in the air

props.synopsis: Tasmania's Supreme Court quashes a tribunal decision that would have forced a museum to allow men to enter its women-only "Ladies' Lounge".

title.children: 'Women are better than men': Mona curator celebrates after Supreme Court win for ladies lounge

title.children: The system allowing people with disability to be paid $6 an hour

image.altText: Sugra Barkati walks with supporters while being escorted by armed soldiers.

props.synopsis: The 17-year-old and her brother, 11, emerge as unexpected symbols of resilience as they draw crowds to rallies across Kashmir and campaign for their father â€” a jailed separatist.Â

image.altText: Photo: Matt Davis

props.synopsis: Exposure to violence defined Darryl's early life, before he turned to violence himself. Today, Darryl teaches positive masculinity and uses boxing to empower communities and help break the cycle.

title.children: Darryl Gardiner has been a victim, an offender and a survivor. In the conversation about a domestic violence crisis, his voice is crucial

title.children: What happens with Trump's criminal cases if he wins the election?

image.altText: Three young people sit on the floor of an office, leaning against a wall, smiling.

props.synopsis: Many Australians are neurodivergent, yet some don't disclose this to employers for fear of discrimination. So how practical is it to create a neurodivergent-friendly workplace?

title.children: One in five Australians are neurodivergent, and there are numerous barriers they face in the workplace

image.altText: Jannik Sinner holds the Australian Open trophy after winning the 2024 men's final.

image.altText: Treasure Boxes volunteers  2024-06-25 09:06:00

props.synopsis: Thousands of pregnant women in Australia are going hungry with half of those too scared to ask for help, according to new research.

title.children: One in ten expecting mothers are going hungry, survey finds

image.altText: An orange flash had been enveloped by the great uprush of water. Immense clouds of smoke, steam and spray burst into the air.

props.synopsis: Indonesia and Solomon Islands have signed up to ban the bomb. Experts say Australia's reluctance to do so could spur tension with its neighbours.

title.children: Why some argue Australia wants 'to have cake and eat it too' on nuclear weapons

image.altText: A teenage girl operates her phone while sitting at a desk with a cat perched on it.

props.synopsis: Girls as young as 14 are considering diets and cosmetic procedures after bouts of cyberbullying, researchers say.

image.altText: Two fisheries patrol boats on the water

image.altText: A composite image of flour made from lupin and lupin beans still on the plant.

props.synopsis: Lupin is traditionally used to feed cattle in Australia but aged care facilities are now adding it to their residents' food. The nutrition results experienced in the program are being labelled as "remarkable".

title.children: Turning cattle feed into nutritional flour for aged care residents

image.altText: Rodney standing in burnt down room, arms crossed.

title.children: Fire leaves family with nothing after home insurance confusion

image.altText: Josh Warneke with mum Ingrid

title.children: The inquest into the mysterious death of a WA tradie has finished. What have we learned?

image.altText: A tin shed partially submerged in floodwaters

title.children: More than 60 killed, dozens injured and stranded amid flooding and landslides in Nepal

image.altText: shelves without eggs at supermarket.

props.synopsis: It has been months since a deadly bird flu outbreak devastated farms, but eggs remain in short supply across the country.

title.children: Seeing empty egg shelves? It could still take some time for Australia's supply to recover

image.altText: A picture of cyclist Muriel Furrer on a screen

props.synopsis: Cycling has lost another rider due to a downhill crash, with teenager Muriel Furrer killed on a descent at the World Championships in Zurich. So where does the responsibility lie?

title.children: 'We are nothing on Earth and even less on a bike': The intrinsic failings and risks of cycling laid bare with another premature death

image.altText: A couple, one wearing blue and another wearing a white t-shirt, stand in front of their roadside stall. The woman is holding

props.synopsis: A fruit and vegetable grower with a roadside stall says it's been a bumper year as people with discretionary income â€” and a distrust of major supermarkets â€” shop around.

image.altText: Adam Scott and Taylor Pendrith at the Presidents Cup

props.synopsis: America's golf stars hit back after being swept on day two, and even a shot that needed to be seen to be believed from a Korean star wasn't enough to rescue the Internationals.

title.children: Teammate's 'impossible' shot in vain as Adam Scott, Internationals fall in deep Presidents Cup hole
